data.title: The best bakery in the USA
data.text: Get the rum cake, get ANY of the beautifully decorated pastries!  Perfect color, and all the bread is spot on too.

data.title: Unique Acadiana Bakery
data.text: Poupart's has an eclectic selection of pastries and desserts. It is somewhat unique to the Acadiana area and absolutely delicious. A little pricey but worth it!

data.title: THE BEST PISTOLETTES!!!!
data.text: I swear I will be on "My 600lb Life" if I ate a pistolette every time I wanted one! THEY ARE DELICIOUS!!! Like a eyes-roll-back-into-your-head, Calgon-take-me-away kinda delicious. :) Get the shrimp or the crawfish, thank me later. :)

data.title: Wonderful Treats
data.text: Always wonderful snacks.  A very delicious lemon meringue pie.  Great breads.  A large variety of cookies,

data.title: One of the very best bakeries on the EARTH!!!
data.text: A french born baker operates this exceptional bakery which also specializes in local favorites.  It's a super place for lunch or to buy any of dozens of specialty baked goods.  Their king cake is the best I've ever dreamed of and comes in several flavors.  The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly.  Don't miss this one!!!!

data.title: A bit of Lafayette history here.
data.text: Francois Poupart came from France and worked at the Restaurant Normandy somewhere in the 60's. His Normandy bread quickly attained notoriety. He would import flour from France to make his baguettes.

data.title: First time at a Bistro
data.text: Another place to check out when in downtown Lafayette.  Plenty of sandwiches and pastry's to choose from. Coffee was good and hot.

data.title: In one word: Ciabatta
data.text: Like going to France/Italy locally when it comes to their bread.  We stock up whenever we get the chance.  Their breads are the best and so are the other items, but since not a big cake person, stick with the ciabatta bread.  If you want to make a desert of it, just break off a piece and eat with a good quality chocolate together.  It's like eating an eclair, but with less than half the fat and calories and even better since it just is.  Try it together.

data.title: Best Bakery in Lafayette
data.text: This is a fantastic bakery. Everything is fresh, the variety is outstanding, and you will be able to try things that you can't find anywhere else. Their King Cake during Mardi Gras season is not to be missed.  It's not like the others you've had. It's old school. Light. Really great.

data.title: Not open 24/7
data.text: Wonderful real French Bakery and Bistro. We had a sample of their bakery desserts. Each and every morsel was better than the next.

data.title: Fabulous pastries!
data.text: Pouparts has been around for many years.  Excellent cakes and pastries - some with a french twist.  Love it all!

data.title: The Best in French Pastry!
data.text: Wow! Everything in Poupart's Bakery is wonderful. I absolutely love the Petit Fours, but all of their pastries are delicious to the eye and the palate!

data.title: Best pastries in town
data.text: Always great to go in and see the fabulous selection. There even serve sandwiches at lunch. Been around for years and you will always find some deliciousness to try.

data.title: Best bread in town
data.text: For a european to find good bread in US is often a challenge. It will be forever a mystery for us why Americans love such a soft bread that you could easily it without teeth. However in every town exceptions exist and this is the place for Lafayette. Not that the bread is perfect here. It is still a little bit soft and cakes are really too sweet, however you cannot find anything better in Lafayette.

data.title: Small Part of France in Lafayette
data.text:
We love Pouparts!  The breads and pastries are always fresh and delicious.  You can stop by and drink coffee
and enjoy a pastry or sandwich during the day.  Our favorite is the ciabatta bread.  We usually buy extra loaves to freeze.  The locally made products are good as well.  The bisques are so tasty, and our daughter enjoys the crawfish pies!

data.title: So delicious!  You will want to try everything.
data.text: We went for the Dobash Cakes which we ended up buying the small version which were extremely sweet but yet delicious!  We then ended up buying warm breakfast sandwiches which were incredible.  Get there early because they sell out fast.  We were there shortly after they opened and they were almost out.  We also purchased a variety of other items and very much enjoyed every single tiny morsel!!!  Highly recommend the visit to this treat of a shop!  Prices aren't cheap but they are well worth every single penny!  It's a local business which is awesome, it's not sparkly, the parking is good.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Absolutely love the treats here! The rum cake is delicious, but if you visit, you just HAVE to go during Mardi Gras season to get the king cak!

data.title: Delicious French Bakery and Lunch bistro
data.text: Delicious french bakery.  Serves soup and sandwich combo for lunch.  They also have soups ready from their freezer. I love to run in on a cold day and gather up a soup, fresh baked bread and dessert for a nice dinner.  Try their King Cakes when in season.  The blueberry cream cheese is one of my favorites!

data.title: Breakfast or Lunch, Poupart's is always delicious!
data.text: My wife loves going to Poupart's to get some of their delicious baked goods. They also search lunch if you need a good sandwich to eat. Also if you can also find cheap day-old baked goods from the day before if you get there at the right time!

data.title: True French Bakery
data.text:
Expensive. Not a friendly place. I live in Lafayette, and we do go frequently.Their French bread is delicious.
 It has a great crust---just like France. Dobash cakes are a favorite of my children, so I purchase that as well. They do serve soups, etc; however, I have not tasted . It is like a true French bakery---You have locals that actually meet there and drink coffee and visit. It's a gathering place. This is different from the service you get when buying pastries. Their selection of pastries is great. You can buy sugar free cookies; preserves, frozen foods, and more. IT is expensive.
